info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 5:54PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Schenectady, Schoharie and south central Montgomery Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Schenevus, or 13 miles east of Oneonta, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Jefferson, Duanesburg, Middleburgh, Summit, Schoharie, Richmondville, Sharon Springs, Delanson, North Blenheim, Breakabeen, Central Bridge, Carlisle, Sharon, Seward, Charleston, Esperance, Zeh Corners, Beekman Corners and West Richmondville. This includes Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for east central New York.
